Name: Accepted system or system element
Documentation: System or system element (product or service) accepted by an acquirer from a supplier consistent with the delivery conditions of the supply agreement.

Name: Acquired system or system element
Documentation: System or system element (product or service) delivered to the acquirer from a supplier consistent with the delivery conditions of the acquisition agreement.

Name: Acquisition agreement
Documentation: Mutual acknowledgment of terms and conditions under which a working relationship is conducted between an acquirer and a supplier. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 2023).

Name: Acquisition need
Documentation: Identified need that cannot be met within the organization encountering the need or a need that can be met in a more economical way by a supplier.

Name: Acquisition payment
Documentation: Payments or other compensations for an acquired system.

Name: Acquisition records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to acquisition.

Name: Acquisition report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the acquisition activities.

Name: Acquisition strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform acquisition.

Name: Agreements
Documentation: Agreements from all applicable life cycle processes, including: acquisition agreement and supply agreement.

Name: Alternative solution classes
Documentation: Identifies and describes the classes of solutions that may address the problem or opportunity.

Name: Analysis Situation
Documentation: Analyses that arise from any stakeholder. Can originate from any life cycle process.

Name: Applicable laws and regulations
Documentation: International, national, or local laws or regulations.

Name: Breakdown structures
Documentation: Hierarchical representations of project aspects into smaller components providing the necessary frameworks to accomplish the project objectives and create the required deliverables.

Name: Business or mission analysis  report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the business or mission analysis activities.

Name: Business or mission analysis records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to business or mission analysis.

Name: Business or mission analysis strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform business or mission analysis.

Name: Business plan
Documentation: The overall organization business plan, including the business objectives.

Name: Candidate Items for configuration management
Documentation: Items for configuration control. Can originate from any life cycle process.

Name: Candidate items for information management
Documentation: Items for information control. Can originate from any life cycle process.

Name: Candidate risks and opportunities
Documentation: Risks and opportunities that arise from any stakeholder. Can originate from any life cycle process.

Name: Change request
Documentation: Identified anomaly, required, or recommended enhancement to a project, from the time an idea is recorded until the disposition by a designated change authority. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, 2017).

Name: Concept of operations (ConOps)
Documentation: At the organization level, addresses the leadership’s intended way of operating the organization (ISO/IEC/IEEE 29148, 2018).

Name: Configuration baseline
Documentation: Configuration information formally designated at a specific time during the life of a product, product component, service, or service component. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, 2017).

Name: Configuration management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to configuration management.

Name: Configuration management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the configuration management activities.

Name: Configuration management system
Documentation: System used to support and enable configuration management.

Name: Configuration managemnt strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform configuration management.

Name: Configuration verification and audit report
Documentation: Provides results of configuration management verifications and audits to ensure adequate traceability, control, and visibility. It includes evaluation criteria.

Name: Constraints on solution
Documentation: Externally imposed limitation on the system, its design, or implementation or on the process used to develop or modify a system. (ISO/IEC/IEEE 29148, 2018).

Name: Critical performance measurement data
Documentation: Data provided for the identified system-of-interest measurement needs.

Name: Critical performance measurement needs
Documentation: Identified information needs of the decision makers with respect to system-of-interest expectations.

Name: Customer satisfaction inputs
Documentation: Responses to customer satisfaction surveys or other instruments.

Name: Decision management records/artifacts
Documentation:
An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the decision management activities.

INCOSE Systems Engineering Handbook, John Wiley & Sons, Incorporated, 2023. ProQuest Ebook Central

Name: Decision management report
Documentation:
An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the decision management activities.

INCOSE Systems Engineering Handbook, John Wiley & Sons, Incorporated, 2023. ProQuest Ebook Central, http://ebookcentral.proquest.com/lib/bosch/detail.action?docID=7260875.

Name: Decision management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform decision management.

Name: Decision register
Documentation: A repository that supports the availability for use and communication of all relevant decision information in a timely, complete, valid, and, if required, confidential manner.

Name: Decision situations
Documentation: Decisions that arise from any stakeholder. Can originate from any life cycle process.

Name: Design definition records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to design definition.

Name: Design definition report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the design definition activities.

Name: Design definition strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform design definition.

Name: Disposal procedure
Documentation: Presents an ordered series of steps to perform disposal.

Name: Disposal records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to disposal.

Name: Disposal report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the disposal activities.

Name: Disposal strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform disposal.

Name: Disposed system
Documentation: System (product or service) that has been deactivated, disassembled, and removed from operations and been properly disposed.

Name: Enabling systems
Documentation: External systems that facilitate the life cycle activities of the SoI but are not a direct element of the operational environment.

Name: Human resource management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to human resource management.

Name: Human resource management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the human resource management activities.

Name: Human resource management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform human resource management.

Name: Implementation records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to implementation.

Name: Implementation report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the implementation activities.

Name: Implementation strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform implementation.

Name: Information management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to information management.

Name: Information management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the information management activities.

Name: Information management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform information management.

Name: Information register
Documentation: A repository that supports the availability for use and communication of all relevant project information artifacts in a timely, complete, valid, and, if required, restricted manner.

Name: Infrastructure management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to infrastructure management.

Name: Infrastructure management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the infrastructure management activities.

Name: Infrastructure management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform infrastructure management.

Name: Installation procedure
Documentation: Presents an ordered series of steps to perform transition.

Name: Installed system
Documentation: System (product or service) that has been installed in its operational environment.

Name: Integrated system or system element
Documentation: System or system element (product or service) that has been aggregated from system elements.

Name: Integration procedure
Documentation: Presents an ordered series of steps to perform integration.

Name: Integration records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to integration.

Name: Integration report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the integration activities.

Name: Integration strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform integration.

Name: Knowledge management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to knowledge management.

Name: Knowledge management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the knowledge management activities.

Name: Knowledge management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform knowledge management.

Name: Knowledge management system
Documentation: System used to support and enable knowledge management.

Name: Life cycle concepts
Documentation: Articulation and refinement of the various life cycle concepts consistent with the stakeholder needs. Typical concepts include: acquisition concept; deployment concept; operational concept (OpsCon); support concept; retirement conce

Name: Life cycle model management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to life cycle model management.

Name: Life cycle model management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the life cycle model management activities.

Name: Life cycle model management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform life cycle model management.

Name: Life cycle models
Documentation: Framework of processes and activities concerned with the life cycle that can be organized into stages, acting as a common reference for communication and understanding. (ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 2023)

Name: Maintained and sustained system
Documentation: System (product or service) that has been maintained for use in its operational environment.

Name: Maintenance and logistics procedure
Documentation: Presents an ordered series of steps to perform maintenance.

Name: Maintenance and logistics records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to maintenance.

Name: Maintenance and logistics report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the maintenance activities.

Name: Maintenance and logistics strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform maintenance.

Name: Measurement data
Documentation: Measurement data from all applicable life cycle processes, including: critical performance measurement data, organizational measurement data, and project measurement data.

Name: Measurement needs
Documentation: Measurement needs from all applicable life cycle processes, including: critical performance measurement needs, organizational measurement needs, and project measurement needs.

Name: Measurement records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to measurement.

Name: Measurement register
Documentation: A repository that supports the availability for use and communication of all relevant measures in a timely, complete, valid, and, if required, confidential manner.

Name: Measurement report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the measurement activities.

Name: Measurement strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform measurement.

Name: Operation procedure
Documentation: Presents an ordered series of steps to perform operation.

Name: Operation records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to operation.

Name: Operation report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the operation activities.

Name: Operation strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform operation.

Name: Operational system
Documentation: System (product or service) being used in its operational environment.

Name: Organization infrastructure
Documentation: Resources, facilities, personnel, and/or services that support the organization.

Name: Organization infrastructure needs
Documentation: Identified organizational infrastructure needs.

Name: Organization lessons learned
Documentation: Organizational-related lessons learned. Results from an evaluation or observation of an implemented corrective action that contributed to improved performance or increased capability. A lesson learned also results from an evaluation or observation of a positive finding that did not necessarily require corrective action other than sustainment.

Name: Organization policies
Documentation: High-level direction at the organizational level consistent with the organization’s strategies. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Organization portfolio direction and constraints
Documentation: Organization direction and constraints related to the project portfolio.

Name: Organization procedures
Documentation: Presents an ordered series of steps to perform a process, activity, or task for an organization. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Organization processes
Documentation: Set of interrelated or interacting activities that transform inputs into outputs for an organization. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 2023)

Name: Organization reports
Documentation: Reports from all applicable organization life cycle processes, including: life cycle model management report, infrastructure management report, portfolio management report, human resource management report, quality management report, and knowledge management report.

Name: Organization strategic plan
Documentation: The overall organization strategy, including the business mission or vision and strategic goals and objectives.

Name: Organization strategies/approaches
Documentation: Strategies/approaches for all applicable organization life processes, including: life cycle model management strategy/approach, infrastructure management strategy/approach, portfolio management strategy/approach, human resource management strategy/approach, quality management strategy/approach, and knowledge management strategy/approach.

Name: Organization tailoring strategy/approach
Documentation: Organization’s specific strategy and approach to tailoring required to incorporate new or updated external standards.

Name: Organizational measurement data
Documentation: Data provided for the identified organizational measurement needs.

Name: Organizational measurement needs
Documentation: Identified information needs of the decision makers with respect to organizational expectations.

Name: Other validated artifacts
Documentation: Artifacts that are validated

Name: Other verified artifacts
Documentation: Artifacts that are verified

Name: Portfolio management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to portfolio management.

Name: Portfolio management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the portfolio management activities.

Name: Portfolio management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform portfolio management.

Name: Problem or opportunity statement
Documentation: Description of the problem or opportunity. Should be derived from the organization strategy and provide enough detail to understand the gap or new capability that is being considered

Name: Problem or opportunity statement
Documentation: Description of the problem or opportunity. Should be derived from the organization strategy and provide enough detail to understand the gap or new capability that is being considered

Name: Project assessment and control records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to project assessment and control.

Name: Project assessment and control strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform project assessment and control.

Name: Project authorization
Documentation: Authorization from the organization to proceed per the agreed-to project plan.

Name: Project authorization request
Documentation: Request from the project to the organization to authorize the project.

Name: Project budget
Documentation: Estimate of the costs associated with a particular project. Includes labor, infrastructure, acquisition, and enabling system costs along with reserves for risk management.

Name: Project constraints
Documentation: Externally imposed limitation on the project developing or modifying a system. (ISO/IEC/IEEE 29148, 2018)

Name: Project control request
Documentation: Project directives based on action required due to deviations from the project plan. If assessments are associated with a decision gate, a decision to proceed or not to proceed, is taken.

Name: Project decision gate/review result
Documentation: Decision gate and review artifacts that are expected through conduct of the decision gate or technical review and that can be considered elements of exit criteria. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24748–8, 2019)

Name: Project direction
Documentation: Organizational direction to the project. Includes sustainment of projects meeting objectives and redirection or termination of projects not meeting objectives.

Name: Project human resource needs
Documentation: Identified human resource needs of the project.

Name: Project infrastructure
Documentation: Resources, facilities, personnel, and/or services that support the project.

Name: Project infrastructure needs
Documentation: Identified infrastructure needs of the project.

Name: Project lessons learned
Documentation: Project-related lessons learned. Results from an evaluation or observation of an implemented corrective action that contributed to improved performance or increased capability. A lesson learned also results from an evaluation or observation of a positive finding that did not necessarily require corrective action other than sustainment.

Name: Project measurement data
Documentation: Data provided for the identified project measurement needs.

Name: Project measurement needs
Documentation: Identified information needs of the decision makers with respect to project expectations.

Name: Project objectives
Documentation: The objectives or goals for the project.

Name: Project planning records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to project planning.

Name: Project portfolio
Documentation: Collection of projects that addresses the strategic objectives of the organization. (ISO/IEC/IEEE 12207, 2017)

Name: Project procedures
Documentation: Procedures from all applicable life cycle processes, including: integration procedure, verification procedure, installation procedure, validation procedure, operation procedure, maintenance and logistics procedure, and disposal procedure.

Name: Project reports
Documentation: Reports from all applicable project life cycle processes, including: acquisition report, supply report, decision management report, risk management report, configuration management report, configuration verification and audit report, information management report, measurement report, quality assurance report, quality assurance evaluation report, business or mission analysis report, stakeholder needs and requirements definition report, system requirements definition report, system architecture definition report, system architecture assessment report, design definition report, system design assessment report, system analysis report, implementation report, integration report, verification report, transition report, validation report, operation report, maintenance and logistics report, and disposal report.

Name: Project schedule
Documentation: A linked list of a project’s milestones, activities, and deliverables with intended start and finish dates May include a top-level milestone schedule and multiple levels (also called tiers) of schedules of increasing detail and task descriptions with completion criteria and work authorizations.

Name: Project status report/dashboard
Documentation: Provides results of monitoring the execution of the defined plan or processes for internal or external distribution. It includes a summary of decisions, monitoring results, action items, process or performance data, and recorded process improvements. It assesses the degree of adherence to the plans. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Project strategies/approaches
Documentation: Strategies/approaches for all applicable project life processes, including: acquisition strategy/approach, supply strategy & approach, project assessment and control strategy/approach, decision management strategy/approach, risk management strategy/approach, configuration management strategy/approach, information management strategy/approach, measurement strategy/approach, quality assurance strategy/approach, business or mission analysis strategy/approach, stakeholder needs and requirements definition strategy/approach, system requirements definition strategy/approach, system architecture definition strategy/approach, design definition strategy/approach, system analysis strategy/approach, implementation strategy/approach, integration strategy/approach, verification strategy/approach, transition strategy/approach, validation strategy/approach, operation strategy/approach, maintenance and logistics strategy/approach, and disposal strategy/approach.

Name: Project tailoring strategy/approach
Documentation: Project’s specific strategy and approach to tailoring required to incorporate new or updated life cycle models.

Name: Qualified personnel
Documentation: Individuals equipped to perform duties on behalf of the organization, including officers, employees, and contractors. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, 2017)

Name: Quality assurance corrective action
Documentation: Action to eliminate the cause or reduce the likelihood of recurrence of a detected project nonconformity or other undesirable situation. (Adapted from ISO/IEC 19770–1, 2017)

Name: Quality assurance evaluation report
Documentation: Provides results of quality assurance evaluations. It includes evaluation criteria. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Quality assurance records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to quality assurance.

Name: Quality assurance report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the quality assurance activities.

Name: Quality assurance strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform quality assurance.

Name: Quality assurance system
Documentation: System used to support and enable quality assurance.

Name: Quality management corrective action
Documentation: Action to eliminate the cause or reduce the likelihood of recurrence of a detected organizational nonconformity or other undesirable situation. (Adapted from ISO/IEC 19770–1, 2017)

Name: Quality management criteria and methods
Documentation: Rules on which a judgment or decision can be based, or by which an organization can be evaluated. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Quality management evaluation report
Documentation: Provides results of quality management evaluations. It includes evaluation criteria. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Quality management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to quality management.

Name: Quality management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the quality management activities.

Name: Quality management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform quality management

Name: Quality management system
Documentation: System used to support and enable quality management.

Name: Records/artifacts
Documentation: Records from all applicable life cycle processes, including: acquisition records/artifacts, supply records/artifacts, life cycle model management records/artifacts, infrastructure management records/artifacts, portfolio management records/artifacts, human resource management records/artifacts, quality management records/artifacts, knowledge management records/artifacts, project planning records/artifacts, project assessment and control records/artifacts, decision management records/artifacts, risk management records/artifacts, configuration management records/artifacts, information management records/artifacts, measurement records/artifacts, quality assurance records/artifacts, business or mission analysis records/artifacts, stakeholder needs and requirements definition records/artifacts, system requirements definition records/artifacts, system architecture definition records/artifacts, design definition records/artifacts, system analysis records/artifacts, implementation records/artifacts, integration records/artifacts, verification records/artifacts, transition records/artifacts, validation records/artifacts, operation records/artifacts, maintenance and logistics records/artifacts, disposal records/artifacts, tailoring records/artifacts.

Name: Request for supply
Documentation: Acquirer’s request for information and commitments needed from the supplier that are required to be included in the potential supplier’s proposal. It announces the acquirer’s intention to potential bidders to acquire a specified system or system element (product or service). (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Requirements imposed on enabling systems
Documentation: Identified requirements for enabling systems of the system-of-interest.

Name: Reused system or system element
Documentation: System or system element (product or service) reused by an organization consistent with its system element requirements.

Name: Risk management records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to risk management.

Name: Risk management report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the risk management activities.

Name: Risk management strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform risk management.

Name: Risk register
Documentation: A repository that supports the availability for use and communication of all relevant risk information in a timely, complete, valid, and, if required, confidential manner.

Name: Source documents
Documentation: External documents relevant to the particular stage of the system of interest.

Name: Stakeholder identification
Documentation: List of individuals or organizations having a right, share, claim, or interest in a system or in its possession of characteristics that meet their needs and expectations. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 2023)

Name: Stakeholder needs and requirements
Documentation: Structured collection of the requirements [characteristics, context, concepts, constraints and priorities] of the stakeholder and the relationship to the external environment. (ISO/IEC/IEEE 29148, 2018)

Name: Stakeholder needs and requirements definition records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to stakeholder needs and requirements definition.

Name: Stakeholder needs and requirements definition report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the stakeholder needs and requirements definition activities.

Name: Stakeholder needs and requirements definition strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform stakeholder needs and requirements definition.

Name: Standards
Documentation: This handbook and relevant industry, country, military, acquirer, and other specifications and standards. Includes new knowledge from industry sponsored knowledge networks.

Name: Supplied system or system element
Documentation: System or system element (product or service) delivered from a supplier to an acquirer consistent with the delivery conditions of the supply agreement.

Name: Supply agreement
Documentation: Mutual acknowledgment of terms and conditions under which a working relationship is conducted between a supplier and an acquirer. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 2023)

Name: Supply payment
Documentation: Payments or other compensations for the supplied system.

Name: Supply records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to supply.

Name: Supply report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the supply activities.

Name: Supply response
Documentation: Prepared by a potential supplier to support the offer of a contract bid, including cost, schedule, risk statements, methodology to satisfy the request for supply, experiences and capabilities, any recommendations to tailor the request for supply or contract, and the signature of the supplier’s approving authority. Informally, may be prepared within an organization. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Supply strategy/ approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform supply.

Name: System analysis records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to system analysis.

Name: System analysis report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the system analysis activities.

Name: System analysis request
Documentation: A request to conduct a system analysis.

Name: System analysis strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform system analysis.

Name: System architecture assessment report
Documentation: Provides results of system architecture assessments. It includes evaluation criteria. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: System architecture definition records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to system architecture definition.

Name: System architecture definition report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the system architecture definition activities.

Name: System architecture definition strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform system architecture definition.

Name: System architecture description
Documentation: The fundamental conception of a system-of-interest in terms of its purpose, system qualities (such as feasibility, performance, safety, and interoperability), constraints, and design decisions and rationale. Identification of the architecture’s stakeholders and the stakeholders’ architecture-related concerns. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: System architecture rationale
Documentation: Rationale for architecture selection, technological/technical system element selection, and allocation between system requirements and architectural entities.

Name: System design assessment report
Documentation: Provides results of system design assessments. It includes evaluation criteria. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: System design characteristics
Documentation: Design attributes or distinguishing features that pertain to a measurable description of a product or service. (ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 2023)

Name: System design description
Documentation: Describes the design of a system or element. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, 2017)

Name: System design rationale
Documentation: Rationale for design selection, system element selection, and allocation between system requirements and system elements. Includes rationale of major selected implementation options and enablers.

Name: System element
Documentation: System element (product or service) implemented consistent with its system element requirements.

Name: System element description
Documentation: Applies the system architecture description to the low-level system configuration items and elements. It is at a level of detail to permit design, implementation, and test. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: System interface definition
Documentation: Description of the interfaces between systems and system elements. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, 2017)

Name: System requirements
Documentation: Structured collection of the requirements [functions, performance, design constraints, and other attributes] for the system and its operational environments and external interfaces. (ISO/IEC/IEEE 29148, 2018)

Name: System requirements definition records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to system requirements definition.

Name: System requirements definition report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the system requirements definition activities.

Name: System requirements definition strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform system requirements definition.

Name: System viewpoints, views, and models
Documentation: Definitions of viewpoints to document the procedures for creating, interpreting, analyzing, and evaluating architectural data. One or more views of the system. Each architectural view is a representation of the complete system from the perspective of one or more system concerns, for its stakeholders. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Systems engineering management plan (SEMP)
Documentation: Presents how the project processes and activities are executed to assure the project’s successful completion, and the quality of the deliverable product or service. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 15289, 2019)

Name: Tailoring records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to tailoring.

Name: Traceability mapping
Documentation: Records the relationship between two or more artifacts of the development process (e.g., requirements, functions, system elements, verifications, and validations, tasks). (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, 2017)

Name: Trained personnel
Documentation: Trained individuals or organizations that perform the operation, maintenance, or other functions of or for a system.

Name: Training materials
Documentation: Materials for the provision of formal and informal learning activities. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, 2017)

Name: Transition records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to transition.

Name: Transition report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the transition activities.

Name: Transition strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform transition.

Name: Validated stakeholder needs and requirements
Documentation: Set of stakeholder needs and requirements that have been validated.

Name: Validated system
Documentation: System (product or service) that has been validated.

Name: Validated system architecture and design
Documentation: System architecture and design that has been validated.

Name: Validation criteria
Documentation: The validation criteria (the measures to be assessed), who will perform validation activities, and the validation environments of the system-of-interest.

Name: Validation procedure
Documentation: Presents an ordered series of steps to perform validation.

Name: Validation records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to validation.

Name: Validation report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the validation activities.

Name: Validation strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform validation.

Name: Variance/deviation/waiver request
Documentation: Request, temporary or permanent, to accept a configuration item or other designated item which, during production or after having been submitted for inspection, is found to depart from specified requirements, but is nevertheless considered suitable for use as is or after rework by an approved method. (Adapted from ISO/IEC/IEEE 24765, 2017)

Name: Verification criteria
Documentation: The verification criteria (the measures to be assessed), who will perform verification activities, and the verification environments of the system-of-interest.

Name: Verification procedure
Documentation: Presents an ordered series of steps to perform verification.

Name: Verification records/artifacts
Documentation: Permanent, readable form of data, information, or knowledge related to verification.

Name: Verification report
Documentation: An account prepared for interested parties in order to communicate the status, results, and outcomes of the verification activities.

Name: Verification strategy/approach
Documentation: Approaches, schedules, resources, and specific considerations required to perform verification.

Name: Verified system
Documentation: System (product or service) that has been verified.

Name: Verified system architecture and design
Documentation: System architecture and design that has been verified.

Name: Verified system requirements
Documentation: Set of system requirements that have been verified.

Name: Acquistion Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Acquisition process is to obtain a product or service in accordance with the acquirer’s requirements.

Activities
Prepare for the acquisition.
Advertise the acquisition and select the supplier.
Establish and maintain an agreement.
Monitor the agreement.
Accept the product or service.

Name: Business or Mission Analysis Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288:

The purpose of the Business or Mission Analysis process is to define the overall strategic problem or opportunity, characterize the solution space, and determine potential solution class(es) that can address a problem or take advantage of an opportunity.

Actvities:

Prepare for business or mission analysis.
Define the problem or opportunity space.
Characterize the solution space.
Evaluate alternative solution classes that span the potential solution space.
Manage the Business or Mission Analysis.

Name: Decision Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As defined by ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288

The purpose of the Decision Management process is to provide a structured, analytical framework for objectively identifying, characterizing and evaluating a set of alternatives for a decision at any point in the life cycle and select the most beneficial course of action.

Activities

Prepare for decisions
Analyze the decison information
Make and manage decisions

Taken from
INCOSE Systems Engineering Handbook, John Wiley & Sons, Incorporated, 2023. ProQuest Ebook Central

Name: Design Definition Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Design Definition process is to provide sufficient detailed data and information about the system and its elements to realize the solution in accordance with the system requirements and architecture.

Activities

Prepare for design definition 
• Create the system design 
• Evaluate the system design 
• Manage results of design definition

Name: Disposal Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Disposal process is to end the existence of a system element or system for a specified intended use, appropriately handle replaced or retired elements, appropriately handle any waste products, and to properly attend to identified critical disposal needs.

Acvtities
Prepare for disposal
Perfrom disposal
Finalize the disposal

Name: Human Resource Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Human Resource Management process is to provide the organization with necessary human resources and to maintain their competencies, consistent with strategic needs.

Actvities:

Identify skills
Develop skills
Acquie and provide skills

Name: Implementation Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 

The purpose of the Implementation process is to realize a specified system element.

Actvities

Prepare for implementation 
• Perform implementation 
• Manage results of implementation

Name: Information Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 

The purpose of the Information Management process is to generate, obtain, confirm, transform, retain, retrieve, disseminate, and dispose of information to designated stakeholders.


Activities 
• Prepare for information management 
• Perform information management

INCOSE Systems Engineering Handbook, John Wiley & Sons, Incorporated, 2023. ProQuest Ebook Central

Name: Infrastructure Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Infrastructure Management process is to provide the infrastructure and services to projects to support organization and project objectives throughout the life cycle.

Name: Integration Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Design Definition process is to provide sufficient detailed data and information about the system and its elements to realize the solution in accordance with the system requirements and architecture.

Name: Knowledge Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Knowledge Management process is to create the capability and assets that enable the organization to exploit opportunities to re-apply existing knowledge.

Actvities:

Plan knowledge management
Share knowledge and skills throuout organziation
Share knowledge assets throuout the organization
Managne knowledge, skills and knowledge assets

Name: Life Cycle Model Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Life Cycle Model Management process is to define, maintain, and help ensure availability of policies, life cycle processes, life cycle models, and procedures for use by the organization with respect to the scope of ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288.

Activities:

Establish the life cycle processes
Assess the life cycle processes
Imrove the process

Name: Maintenance Process
Documentation:
As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

[6.4.13] The purpose of the Maintenance process is to sustain the capability of the system to provide a service.

Activities

Prepare for maintenance and logistics
Perform maintenance
Perform logistics support
Manage results of maintenance and logistics

Name: Measurement process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288 (and ISO/IEC/IEEE 15939), 

The purpose of the Measurement process is to collect, analyze, and report objective data and information to support effective management and address information needs about the products, services, and processes.

Activities 
• Prepare for measurement 
• Perform measurement


INCOSE Systems Engineering Handbook, John Wiley & Sons, Incorporated, 2023. ProQuest Ebook Central

Name: Operation Process
Documentation:
As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Operation process is to use the system to deliver its services.

Activities:
Prepare for operation
Perform operation
Manage results of operation
support stakeholders

Name: Portfolio Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Portfolio Management process is to initiate and sustain necessary, sufficient, and suitable projects to meet the strategic objectives of the organization.

Activities

Define and authorize projects
Evaluate the portfolio of projects
Terminate projects

Name: Project Assessment and Control Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Project Assessment and Control process is to assess if the plans are aligned and feasible; determine the status of the project, technical and process performance; and direct execution to help ensure that the performance is according to plans and schedules, within projected budgets, to satisfy technical objectives.

Actvities:

Plan for project assessment and control
Assess the project
Control the project

Name: Project Planning Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 

The purpose of the Project Planning process is to produce and coordinate effective and workable plans.


Activities 
• Define the project 
• Plan project and technical management 
• Activate the project

Name: Quality Assurance process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, 

The purpose of the Quality Assurance process is to help ensure the effective application of the organization’s Quality Management process to the project.


Typical Inputs 
• Quality management strategy/approach 
• Quality management criteria and methods 
• Quality management report 
• Quality management corrective action Activities 
• Prepare for quality assurance 
• Perform product or service evaluations 
• Perform process evaluations 
• Manage quality assurance records and reports 
• Treat incidents and problems


INCOSE Systems Engineering Handbook, John Wiley & Sons, Incorporated, 2023. ProQuest Ebook Central

Name: Quality Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Quality Management process is to assure that products, services, and implementations of the Quality Management process meet organizational and project quality objectives and achieve customer satisfaction.

Activities

Plan quality management
Assess quality management 
Perform quality management corrective and preventive action

Name: Risk Management Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288, [6.3.4.1] The purpose of the Risk Management process is to identify, analyze, treat and monitor the risks continually.

Activties

Plan risk management
Maintain the risk profile
Analyze risks
Treat risks that exceed their riks threshold
Monitore risks


INCOSE Systems Engineering Handbook, John Wiley & Sons, Incorporated, 2023. ProQuest Ebook Central

Name: Stakeholder Needs and Requirements Definition
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Stakeholder Needs and Requirements Definition process is to define the stakeholder needs and requirements for a system that can provide the capabilities needed by users and other stakeholders in a defined environment.

Name: Supply Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Supply process is to provide an acquirer with a product or service that meets agreed requirements.

Activities:

Prepare for the supply.
Respond to a request for supply of products or services.
Establish and maintain an agreement.
Execute the agreement.
Deliver and support the product or service.

Name: System Analysis Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Transition process is to establish a capability for a system to provide services specified by stakeholder requirements in the operational environment.

Actvities
Prepare for system analysis 
• Perform system analysis 
• Manage system analysis

Name: System Architecture Definition Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the System Architecture Definition process is to generate system architecture alternatives, select one or more alternative(s) that address stakeholder concerns and system requirements, and express this in consistent views and models.

Activities

• Prepare for system architecture definition 
• Conceptualize the system architecture 
• Evaluate the system architecture 
• Elaborate the system architecture 
• Manage results of system architecture definition

Name: System Requierments Definition Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the System Requirements Definition process is to transform the stakeholder, user-oriented view of desired capabilities into a technical view of a solution that meets the operational needs of the user.
Activities:

Prepare for system requirements definition
Define system requirements.
Define system requirements.
Manage system requirements

Name: Transition Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Transition process is to establish a capability for a system to provide services specified by stakeholder requirements in the operational environment.

Name: Validation Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Design Definition process is to provide sufficient detailed data and information about the system and its elements to realize the solution in accordance with the system requirements and architecture.

Actvities:

Prepare for validation
Perform validation
Manage results of validation

Name: Verification Process
Documentation:
Purpose As stated in ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288,

The purpose of the Design Definition process is to provide sufficient detailed data and information about the system and its elements to realize the solution in accordance with the system requirements and architecture.
